text:
This week @ Voltra:

Demand response & market participation now live for connected assets across major US markets and regions.

Device connectivity over MQTT, Modbus, BACnet & DNP3 is now supported for connecting new devices and systems.

Learn more here: https://t.co/HUNXnAIg7W

Platform updates for this week:

- OCPP 2.0.1 support — full implementation and parity with 1.6J
- Map publishing — stations on Google, Tesla, and Apple Maps via OCPI
- ID Tag Manager — manage and debug OCPP auth tags across your fleet

Full notes here: https://t.co/nf3Po6ByPO
Why We Chose Elixir as Our Language of Choice

article.title: Why We Chose Elixir as Our Language of Choice
article.previewText: A friend mentioned Elixir at dinner. At the time, we'd just about had enough building our charger connectivity layer in Java—wrestling with connection state and devices that each speak their own

text:
New this week to the Voltra Platform: 

Smart Charging — sessions optimize automatically on grid signals and tariffs

Direct OCPP action endpoints — full protocol-level charger control via API

Updated Load Management — redesigned UI with groups, nesting, and detailed profiles

Full notes:  https://t.co/uT15Bi9Az3

text: RT @contrary: Congratulations to @alexstratmoen and @AryanAfrouzi on launching Voltra! The world is on the cusp of an energy revolution, an…

We’ll be here today and tomorrow at the #EVChargingExpo2025. Come say hi at Booth 620!

#ElectricVehicles
#EVCharging 
#EVFleets https://t.co/NgVkWGttLG
We are thrilled to announce the launch of our first product Charge, alongside a $1.8M (USD) raise led by Contrary, with participation from Hanover and Velocity fund! (1/3) https://t.co/bi8KVZhDv9

Charge provides software companies in the EV space with the tools needed to seamlessly interface across chargers, connected energy devices, and microgrids. This substantially lowers the barrier to building EV native applications, and will deliver far superior experiences to drivers. (2/3)

It's all part of a much larger vision to build a “connected energy cloud”, providing the software infrastructure needed to rewire North America's Electrical Grids.

Read more at https://t.co/I1kp5JEiv3 (3/3)
